ai-sn9:1.1.2_0: At one time a mendicant was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:1.1.3_0: Now at that time that mendicant, during their day’s meditation, was thinking bad, unskillful thoughts to do with the lay life.
ai-sn9:1.1.4_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that mendicant, and wanted what’s best for them.
ai-sn9:1.1.4_1: and after going, he addressed that monk in verse:
ai-sn9:1.2.2_0: yet your mind strays to outward things.
ai-sn9:1.2.3_0: As a person, you should dispel the desire for people.
ai-sn9:1.2.4_0: Then you’ll be happy, free of greed.
ai-sn9:1.3.2_0: let us remind you of the way of the good.
ai-sn9:1.3.3_0: The dusty abyss is so hard to cross;
ai-sn9:1.3.4_0: don’t let sensual dust drag you down.
ai-sn9:1.4.1_0: Just as a bird strewn with dirt
ai-sn9:1.4.2_0: sheds that clingy dust with a shake;
ai-sn9:1.4.3_0: so too, an energetic, mindful mendicant
ai-sn9:1.4.4_0: sheds that clingy dust with a shake.”
ai-sn9:1.5.1_0: Impelled by that deity, that mendicant was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:2.1.1_0: At one time a mendicant was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:2.1.2_0: Soon afterwards that monk was having gone into the day’s meditation.
ai-sn9:2.1.3_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that mendicant, and wanted what’s best for them.
ai-sn9:2.1.3_1: and after going, he addressed that monk in verse:
ai-sn9:2.2.2_0: Who is the meaning of this?
ai-sn9:2.2.4_0: when injured by an arrow strike?
ai-sn9:2.3.2_0: from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-sn9:2.3.4_0: Don’t fall under the sway of slumber.”
ai-sn9:2.4.2_0: but idiots still fall for them.
ai-sn9:2.4.3_0: Among those who are bound, they’re free and unattached:
ai-sn9:2.5.3_0: that knowledge has been perfectly cleansed:
ai-sn9:3.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Kassapagotta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:3.1.2_0: Now at that time Venerable Kassapagotta was cutting a certain monastery during the day’s meditation.
ai-sn9:3.1.3_0: Then the deity haunting that forest approached Kassapagotta.
ai-sn9:3.1.3_1: and after going, he addressed venerable Kassapa in verse:
ai-sn9:3.2.1_0: “A tribal hunter wandering the rugged hills
ai-sn9:3.2.4_0: this mendicant seems to me like an idiot.
ai-sn9:3.3.1_0: The tribal hunter listens without understanding,
ai-sn9:3.4.1_0: Even if you lit ten lamps
ai-sn9:3.4.2_0: and brought them to him, Kassapa,
ai-sn9:3.4.4_0: for he has no eyes to see.”
ai-sn9:3.5.1_0: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Kassapagotta was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:4.1.1_0: At one time several mendicants were staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:4.1.2_0: So when they had completed the rains residence and the three months had elapsed, those monks left on wandering.
ai-sn9:4.1.3_0: Not seeing those mendicants, the deity haunting that forest cried. And on that occasion they recited this verse:
ai-sn9:4.2.2_0: it seems to me that they must have become dissatisfied.
ai-sn9:4.2.3_0: They were so learned, such brilliant speakers!
ai-sn9:4.2.4_0: Where have these disciples of Gotama gone?”
ai-sn9:4.3.1_0: When they had spoken, another deity replied with this verse:
ai-sn9:4.4.2_0: and some are in the Vajjian lands.
ai-sn9:4.4.3_0: Like deer that wander free of ties,
ai-sn9:5.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:5.1.2_0: Now at that time Ānanda was spending too much time informing the lay people.
ai-sn9:5.1.3_0: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Ānanda, wanting what’s best for him.
ai-sn9:5.1.3_1: and after approaching he addressed venerable Ānanda in verse:
ai-sn9:5.2.1_0: You’ve left for the jungle, the root of a tree,
ai-sn9:5.2.3_0: Practice absorption, Gotama, don’t be negligent!
ai-sn9:5.2.4_0: What is this hullabaloo to you?”
ai-sn9:5.3.1_0: Venerable Ānanda was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:6.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:6.1.2_0: Then a certain deity of the company of the Thirty-Three named Penelope had been Anuruddha’s partner in a former life.
ai-sn9:6.1.2_1: and after going, he addressed venerable Anuruddha in verse:
ai-sn9:6.2.5_0: At the fore of a retinue
ai-sn9:6.3.1_0: “Divine maidens are in a sorry state,
ai-sn9:6.3.3_0: And those beings too are in a sorry state,
ai-sn9:6.3.4_0: who are attached to divine maidens.”
ai-sn9:6.4.2_0: who don’t see the Garden of Delight!
ai-sn9:6.4.3_0: It’s the abode of lordly gods,
ai-sn9:6.5.2_0: the saying of the perfected ones:
ai-sn9:6.6.1_0: Weaver of the web in the company of the gods,
ai-sn9:6.6.2_0: there’ll be no more lives in the hosts of gods.
ai-sn9:6.6.4_0: now there’ll be no more future lives.”
ai-sn9:7.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Nāgadatta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:7.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Nāgadatta was entering the village at the wrong time, and he returned too late in the day.
ai-sn9:7.1.3_0: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Nāgadatta, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up, and show him.
ai-sn9:7.1.3_1: and after going he addressed venerable Nāgasamāla in verse:
ai-sn9:7.2.2_0: and returning after spending too much of the day,
ai-sn9:7.3.1_0: I’m afraid for Nāgadatta; he’s so reckless
ai-sn9:7.3.4_0: under the sway of the terminator!”
ai-sn9:7.4.1_0: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Nāgita was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:8.1.1_0: At one time a monk was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:8.1.2_0: Now at that time that monk had become too closely involved in the affairs of a certain family.
ai-sn9:8.1.3_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that monk, wanting what’s best for him. So, wanting to stir him up, they manifested in the appearance of the mistress of that family, approached the monk,
ai-sn9:8.1.3_1: and after approaching he addressed that mendicant with a verse:
ai-sn9:8.2.3_0: came together and protect the people,
ai-sn9:8.2.4_0: what’s going on between you and me?”
ai-sn9:8.3.2_0: that an austere ascetic must endure.
ai-sn9:8.3.3_0: But they mustn’t be dismayed by that,
ai-sn9:8.3.4_0: for that’s not what defiles you.
ai-sn9:8.4.1_0: And the one who sees clearly
ai-sn9:8.4.2_0: like a wind-deer in the wood,
ai-sn9:9.1.1_0: At one time a certain Vajjian mendicant was staying near Vesālī in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:9.1.2_0: Now at that time in Vesālī the Vajjian capitals had been three nights.
ai-sn9:9.1.3_0: Then that mendicant, groaning at the noise of musical instruments being beaten and played, on that occasion recited this verse:
ai-sn9:9.2.2_0: like a cast-off log in the forest.
ai-sn9:9.3.1_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that mendicant, and wanted what’s best for them.
ai-sn9:9.3.1_1: and after going, he addressed that monk in verse:
ai-sn9:9.4.2_0: like a cast-off log in the forest.
ai-sn9:9.4.3_0: Lots of people are jealous of you,
ai-sn9:9.4.4_0: like beings in hell of those going to heaven.”
ai-sn9:9.5.1_0: Impelled by that deity, that mendicant was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:10.1.1_0: At one time a mendicant was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:10.1.2_0: Now at that time that mendicant had previously been spending too much time in recitation. But some time later they adhered to passivity and silence.
ai-sn9:10.1.3_0: Not hearing the teaching, the deity haunting that forest approached that mendicant.
ai-sn9:10.1.3_1: and after going, he addressed that monk in verse:
ai-sn9:10.2.1_0: “Mendicant, why don’t you recite passages of the teaching,
ai-sn9:10.2.3_0: When you hear the teaching confidence grows;
ai-sn9:10.2.4_0: and the reciter is praised in the present life.”
ai-sn9:10.3.1_0: “I used to be enthusiastic about passages of the teaching,
ai-sn9:10.3.2_0: so long as I’d not realized dispassion.
ai-sn9:10.3.3_0: But then I realized dispassion, which the good call
ai-sn9:10.3.4_0: the laying to rest by completely understanding
ai-sn9:10.3.5_0: whatever is seen, heard, and thought.”
ai-sn9:11.1.1_0: At one time a monk was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:11.1.2_0: Now at that time that mendicant, during their day’s meditation, was thinking bad, unskillful thoughts, that is:
ai-sn9:11.1.4_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that mendicant, and wanted what’s best for them.
ai-sn9:11.1.4_1: and after going, he addressed that monk in verse:
ai-sn9:11.2.3_0: Impropermanent, you’ve got rid of them.
ai-sn9:11.2.4_0: make sure your thoughts are rational.
ai-sn9:11.3.1_0: Thinking about the Teacher, the teaching,
ai-sn9:11.3.2_0: the Saṅgha, and your own ethics,
ai-sn9:11.3.4_0: and rapture and bliss as well, no doubt.
ai-sn9:11.3.5_0: And when you’re full of joy,
ai-sn9:11.3.6_0: you’ll make an end to suffering.”
ai-sn9:11.4.1_0: Impelled by that deity, that mendicant was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:12.1.1_0: At one time a mendicant was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:12.1.2_0: The deity haunting that forest approached that mendicant,
ai-sn9:12.1.2_1: and after approaching he recited this verse in the presence of that monk:
ai-sn9:12.2.2_0: when the birds have settled down,
ai-sn9:12.2.3_0: the formidable jungle whispers to itself:
ai-sn9:12.2.4_0: that seems so scary to me!”
ai-sn9:12.3.2_0: when the birds have settled down,
ai-sn9:12.3.3_0: the formidable jungle whispers to itself:
ai-sn9:12.3.4_0: that seems so delightful to me!”
ai-sn9:13.1.1_0: At one time several mendicants were staying in the Kosalan lands in a certain forest grove. They were restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.
ai-sn9:13.1.2_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for those mendicants, and wanted what’s best for them.
ai-sn9:13.1.2_1: and after approaching he addressed the mendicants in verse:
ai-sn9:13.2.5_0: Knowing that the world was impermanent
ai-sn9:13.2.6_0: they made an end of suffering.
ai-sn9:13.3.1_0: But now they’ve made themselves hard to look after,
ai-sn9:13.3.3_0: They eat and eat and eat and then lie down,
ai-sn9:13.3.4_0: unconscious in the homes of others.
ai-sn9:13.4.1_0: Having raised my joined palms to the Saṅgha,
ai-sn9:13.4.2_0: I say that some people are a killer.
ai-sn9:13.4.4_0: just like those who have passed away.
ai-sn9:13.6.1_0: Impelled by that deity, those mendicants were struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:14.1.1_0: At one time a monk was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
ai-sn9:14.1.2_0: Now at that time after the meal, on his return from alms-round, he took off his meal and left.
ai-sn9:14.1.3_0: The deity haunting that forest had compassion for that mendicant, and wanted what’s best for them.
ai-sn9:14.1.3_1: and after approaching he addressed that mendicant with a verse:
ai-sn9:14.2.1_0: “This water flower has not been given.
ai-sn9:14.2.3_0: just one cloth from the group of travelers.
ai-sn9:14.2.4_0: Good sir, you are a thief of scent!”
ai-sn9:14.3.1_0: “I do not take, nor do I break;
ai-sn9:14.3.2_0: I sniff the water flower from afar.
ai-sn9:14.3.4_0: do you call me a thief of scent?
ai-sn9:14.5.4_0: You’re the one who deserves to be spoken to.
ai-sn9:14.6.1_0: To the man who has not a blemish
ai-sn9:14.6.4_0: seems as big as a cloud.”
ai-sn9:14.7.4_0: whenever you see something like this.”
ai-sn9:14.8.2_0: nor would they be afraid of you,
ai-sn9:14.8.4_0: the way that leads to a good place.”
ai-sn9:14.9.1_0: Impelled by that deity, that mendicant was struck with a sense of urgency.
ai-sn9:14.9.2_0: The first sub-chapter on forest is finished.
ai-sn9:14.11.4_0: and it makes it known to the bloated state of existence.
ai-sn9:14.11.5_0: The Linked Discourses on the rainy season are complete.
